div.h3: Minimal interface for soulbinding EIP-721 NFTs
div.p: This standard is an extension of EIP-721. It proposes a minimal interface to make tokens soulbound using the feature detection functionality of EIP-165. A soulbound token is a non-fungible token bound to a single account.

The Ethereum community has expressed a need for non-transferrable, non-fungible, and socially-priced tokens similar to World of Warcraft‚Äôs soulbound items. But the lack of a token standard leads many developers to simply throw errors upon a user‚Äôs invocation of transfer functionalities. Over the long term, this will lead to fragmentation and less composability.
In this document, we outline a minimal addition to EIP-721 that allows wallet implementers to check for a token contract‚Äôs permanent (non-)transferrability using EIP-165.

The keywords ‚ÄúMUST‚Äù, ‚ÄúMUST NOT‚Äù, ‚ÄúREQUIRED‚Äù, ‚ÄúSHALL‚Äù, ‚ÄúSHALL NOT‚Äù, ‚ÄúSHOULD‚Äù, ‚ÄúSHOULD NOT‚Äù, ‚ÄúRECOMMENDED‚Äù, ‚ÄúMAY‚Äù and ‚ÄúOPTIONAL‚Äù in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

A token with a uint256 tokenId may be inseparably-nound to a receiving account with function locked(...) returning true. In this case, all EIP-721 functions of the contract that transfer the token from one account to another must throw.

code.span: /// @notice Emitted when the locking status is changed to locked.
/// @dev If a token is minted and the status is locked, this event should be emitted.
/// @param tokenId The identifier for a token.
/// @notice Emitted when the locking status is changed to unlocked.
/// @dev If a token is minted and the status is unlocked, this event should be emitted.
/// @param tokenId The identifier for a token.
/// @notice Returns the locking status of an Soulbound Token
/// @dev SBTs assigned to zero address are considered invalid, and queries
/// @param tokenId The identifier for an SBT.

div.p: To aid recognition that an EIP-721 token implements soulbinding via this EIP upon calling EIP-721‚Äôs function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceID) external view returns (bool) with interfaceID=0xb45a3c0e, a contract implementing this EIP must return true.
The above model is the simplest possible path towards a canonical interface for Soulbound tokens. It reflects upon the numerous Soulbound token implementations that simply revert upon transfers.
This proposal is fully backward compatible with EIP-721.
There are no security considerations related directly to the implementation of this standard.
